page.title: 09The Water Mill,Stebbing
page.content: Town Mill was built in 1750 on the site of a Saxon mill mentioned in the Domesday Book. It is weather boarded with clay tile roofing.{Still a working mill,}it grinds oats,barley and beans for animal feed,producing nearly 50 tons per week,which is sold locally. Since 1960 the mill has been run by electricity,but the old machinery is still used on special occasions. The old wooden wheel was replaced in 1877 by a cast-iron{pitch-back wheel} which does not rust.There{are only two {such wheels in Essex.}It measures 14ft 8ins in diameter and is 8ft 4ins wide. It weighs 7 tons and turns at 6.25 R.P.M.when 25 to 30 tons of water pass through each minute. {The mill pond}was hand- made and the flood gates and flashes control the level of water.
